abstract.t: Data forwarding to a Mobile IPv6 mobile node employs eitherencapsulation or routing header -based forwarding, latter when usingroute optimization. Forwarding through a domain with hierarchicalextensions to Mobile IPv6 by default uses encapsulation to passroute-optimized packets over the last hop to the mobile node.However, it is highly desirable to avoid the overhead of sendingan extra 40 byte encapsulation header per packet over the lasthop. This document describes Mobile IPv6 regional forwarding whichis an optional optimized data forwarding method. It avoids theencapsulation header and can be used e.g. with Mobile IPv6 RegionalRegistrations.
